Comments_List: I learned about device physics, semiconductor device technology, and nanofabrication via photolithography.
Deeper look into different silicon based devices that are relevant to today's electronic devices.
The course is well laid out and I have no complaints about the structure of the class.

The lab could have been structured such that you grow all the initial oxide layers on the first lab session and thus freed up more lab periods. Also, not having the students do the measurements precluded some additional learning value.

The instruction was very fast paced.

Yes. For anyone who is conducting research into semiconductors or using nanofabrication techniques in their research, this course offers an excellent survey of device physics and the principles of semiconductor device fabrication. The course does not dwell on lengthy derivations, but rather seeks to explain how the physics can be applied to engineering functional and practical semiconductor devices.
Yes, Professor Ma is a wealth of knowledge in this field and made it very interesting and relative to current technology.
